headline.main: Conquering Food Deserts With Green Carts

docs.lead_paragraph: Pfizer, which has been selling off units to concentrate on development of medicines, may be ready to sell the nutrition unit to Nestlé.

headline.seo: Pfizer Close to Selling Its Infant Nutrition Unit
headline.main: Pfizer Close to Selling Another Unit
headline.print_headline: Pfizer Close To Selling Another Unit

docs.abstract: Pfizer is said to be near a deal to sell its infant nutrition business, with Nestle the likely leading bidder; deal would be latest move by Pfizer to reshuffle its business mix and focus on the core business of developing new medicines.
docs.snippet: Pfizer, which has been selling off units to concentrate on development of medicines, may be ready to sell the nutrition unit to Nestlé.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

docs.lead_paragraph: Two new studies say that poor neighborhoods have a wider variety of food choices than do more affluent ones, and found no relationship between the type of food being sold and obesity.

headline.seo: Food Deserts and Obesity Role Challenged
headline.main: Studies Question the Pairing of Food Deserts and Obesity
headline.print_headline: Studies Question the Pairing Of Food Deserts and Obesity

docs.abstract: Two studies say that poor neighborhoods have a wider variety of food choices than many affluent ones, and find no relationship between the type of food being sold and obesity; the findings raise questions about the effectiveness of efforts to combat the obesity epidemic simply by improving access to healthy foods.
docs.snippet: Two new studies say that poor neighborhoods have a wider variety of food choices than do more affluent ones, and found no relationship between the type of food being sold and obesity.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

docs.abstract: Maybe some of us simply weren't built to be vegans. Is the diet good for everyone?
docs.snippet: Maybe some of us simply weren't built to be vegans. Is the diet good for everyone?

headline.main: Seared Red Rice With Spinach, Mushrooms, Carrot and Egg

docs.lead_paragraph: FromBill Clinton toEllen DeGeneres, celebrities are singing the benefits of a vegan diet. Books that advocate plant-based eating are best sellers. But is eliminating meat and dairy as simple as it sounds? As countless aspiring vegans are discovering, the switch from omnivore to herbivore is fraught with physical, social and economic challenges - at least, for those who don't have a personal chef. The struggle to give up favorite foods like cheese and butter can be made all the harder by harsh words and eye-rolling from unsympathetic friends and family members. Substitutes like almond milk and rice milk can shock the taste buds, and vegan specialty and convenience foods can cost two to three times what their meat and dairy equivalents do. And new vegans quickly discover that many foods in grocery stores and on restaurant menus have hidden animal ingredients.

headline.main: Hard Road For Those Who Seek Veganism

docs.abstract: Tara Parker-Pope Well column evaluates the physical, social and economic challenges of vegan diets, which are increasingly popular among Americans. Photos (M)H
